edu.neu.ccs.cs5004.problem2

Interface IPolynomial

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Polynomial

    public interface IPolynomial

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      IPolynomial add(IPolynomial object)
      A method that takes another polynomial and adds it to the original.
      void addTerm(Integer coefficient, Integer power)
      AddTerm method allows the user to add a coefficient and power to a given polynomial.
      static IPolynomial emptyPolynomial()
      Create the empty polynomial.
      Double evaluate(Double number)
      Method evaluates the polynomial by interchanging the variables with the inputted Double.
      Integer getCoefficient(Integer power)
      Gets the coefficient that has the specific power Integer attached to it.
      Integer getDegree()
      Gets the highest degree of the polynomial.
      Boolean isEmpty()
      Checks to see if the Polynomial expression contains no nodes (is empty - returns true if the expression is empty, returns false if the expression contains nodes).
      Boolean isSame(IPolynomial object)
      Takes another polynomial object and returns true to check if they are the same.
      IPolynomial multiply(IPolynomial object)
      A method that takes another polynomial and multiplies it to the original.
      void removeTerm(Integer power)
      removeTerm method gives the user the ability to remove any, and all coefficients with that specific power.

    • Method Detail

      • emptyPolynomial

        static IPolynomial emptyPolynomial()
        Create the empty polynomial.
        Returns:
        the empty polynomial

      • addTerm

        void addTerm(Integer coefficient,
             Integer power)
        AddTerm method allows the user to add a coefficient and power to a given polynomial.
        Parameters:
        coefficient - the coefficient to be added to the polynomial
        power - the power the coefficient will be raised to.

      • removeTerm

        void removeTerm(Integer power)
        removeTerm method gives the user the ability to remove any, and all coefficients with that specific power.
        Parameters:
        power - the power (exponent) that is used to search for the coefficient we want to remove

      • getDegree

        Integer getDegree()
        Gets the highest degree of the polynomial.
        Returns:
        the highest degree of the polynomial, represented as an Integer.

      • getCoefficient

        Integer getCoefficient(Integer power)
        Gets the coefficient that has the specific power Integer attached to it.
        Parameters:
        power - the degree that a coefficient is raised to
        Returns:
        a coefficient

      • isSame

        Boolean isSame(IPolynomial object)
        Takes another polynomial object and returns true to check if they are the same. Two polynomials are the same if they contain the same terms.
        Parameters:
        object - a polynomial
        Returns:
        true or false

      • isEmpty

        Boolean isEmpty()
        Checks to see if the Polynomial expression contains no nodes (is empty - returns true if the expression is empty, returns false if the expression contains nodes).
        Returns:
        true or false

      • evaluate

        Double evaluate(Double number)
        Method evaluates the polynomial by interchanging the variables with the inputted Double.
        Parameters:
        number - the number to interchange the variables with.
        Returns:
        the result of the polynomial, when using the specific number

      • add

        IPolynomial add(IPolynomial object)
        A method that takes another polynomial and adds it to the original.
        Parameters:
        object - a polynomial expression
        Returns:
        a new polynomial

      • multiply

        IPolynomial multiply(IPolynomial object)
        A method that takes another polynomial and multiplies it to the original.
        Parameters:
        object - a polynomial expression
        Returns:
        a new polynomial
